item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: Scientists have been puzzling over a weird little fossil called Pikaia for decades. Is this 508-million-year-old creature our pre-vertebrate cousin? Now a team of researchers says the confusion all came from how we looked it it. We've had Pikaia upside down the whole time. Gift link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/11/science/pikaia-vertebrate-evolution.html?unlocked_article_code=1.y00._CN-.HQ58uKBNS6lC&smid=url-share

item.title: John Carlos Baez
item.description: I quit Twitter and moved to Mastodon in October 2022 when Elon Musk took over. Many other academics also came to Mastodon, and I was very happy - see my pinned posts. But most of them later became inactive. I stick around because I've decided that corporate-owned social media are dangerous - especially now, when authoritarians are spreading their reach. Turns out it's unrealistic to expect that most academics feel this way - yet. They may get the idea when it's too late.(1/2)https://arxiv.org/abs/2406.04005

item.title: Kriszta Satori
item.description:
Polish FM Radek #Sikorski , at the #Ukraine Recovery Conference:
"When you look at the world from Warsaw, 250 km north is the #Kaliningrad exclave, #Russia , with a storage place for we think roughly a 100 tactical nuclear warheads... and then 250 km to the south east is the Ukrainian border. Some of those Russian missiles [shot at Ukraine] cross into Poland. One of them landed 10 km from my house, 250 km from here. So this is far closer, the danger is much bigger than some people think."
